Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory669.jpg'}
{3: "During the festival, Constellia is even more dazzling and colorful than usual. Perhaps it's best described as tipping an entire paint box straight into water."}
{3: "That's exactly what they would say with a perfectly straight face."}
{3: 'Lost in thought as you weave through the crowd, you suddenly spot a familiar flash of silvery white at a nearby stall.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Drying flowers before they wilt is a fascinating process. Question: how long will their original colors last?', 4: '18'}
{2: 'Gardener Mechanoid', 3: 'Tests show that within the stated ranges of temperature, humidity, and artificial light intensity, the colors last about one year on average.', 4: '18'}
{2: '(Quietly approach)', 3: '13'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Good day, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The white mechanoid woman looks mildly surprised, and a subtle warmth softens her voice.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: "It's been a while. A pleasure to meet you at the exhibition.", 4: '1'}
{2: "I've been looking forward to seeing you as well.", 3: '21'}
{2: 'Have you found something that interests you?', 3: '22'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "Pressed-flower collages. You arrange specimens into any pattern on paper, glue them down, and preserve them. It's a vintage craft popular among plant enthusiasts.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'This is my first time seeing the craft in person. The diversity of artistic forms truly is amazing.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Gardener Mechanoid', 3: 'For the Double Seventh Festival craft, our stall provides materials for on-site creation, and the second participant is free. Would you like to join?', 4: '1'}
{2: "What does the first participant pay? I'll cover it.", 3: '28'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: "I've already paid. Thank you, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Following Haicma's gaze, you notice an elegant bouquet of lilies in full bloom beside the table."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: "I cultivated these myself. I've treasured the memory of rescuing flowers with you and had hoped to use this bouquet to express my feelings.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'But I have found a way to preserve those feelings even longer.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Besides, making this with you now makes the experience priceless.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma...', 3: '40', 4: 'Your feelings are priceless as well.', 5: '40'}
{3: 'The stall owner ushers you and Haicma behind a simple wind-break curtain and sets out the materials and tools one by one.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Gardener Mechanoid', 3: 'Steps: design the composition, choose the flowers, arrange and glue them, then frame the artwork. Wishing you both a pleasant Double Seventh Festival.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The mechanoid bows with clumsy sincerity, hums away like a lawn mower, and leaves the two of you alone.'}
{3: 'A wooden crate before you holds many sealed jars. Vivid petals and leaves are frozen at their liveliest, waiting for a creative hand to grant them new life.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Humans call spontaneous creative thought "inspiration." After running a self-check, I can confirm that whenever I\'m with you, inspiration always bursts within me.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'So you already have an idea.', 3: '55'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: '"Galaxy" is such a beautiful word.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Even though luminous celestial bodies are nothing like liquid and come in far more than one color, once I understood how it feels to gaze at the stars from the ground, it became one of my favorite metaphors.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Using the colors of the earth to depict a galaxy?', 3: '58'}
{2: "That's very romantic.", 3: '59', 4: 'Your study of rhetoric is paying off.', 5: '59'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Since this is a joint mission, you should choose the materials. I trust your taste.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'If you pursued the literal meaning of "galaxy," you would choose white, but remembering the sparkle in Haicma\'s eyes when she mentioned "inspiration," your hand shifts course.'}
{3: 'White light is the sum of every color, just like the mechanoid woman before you, filled with endless possibilities.'}
{3: 'Instead, you pick up a jar of tiny petals that match her eye color and gently place one against her temple.'}
{2: 'Light gold really suits your eyes.', 3: '67'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'A colorful galaxy? I see.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Haicma fixes her gaze on the empty black cardstock, running unknown calculations.'}
{3: 'Moments later, she picks up angled tweezers, takes a little from each jar you selected, and quickly arranges the dried flowers into a pattern on the card.'}
{2: "You feel you've seen this design somewhere before...", 3: '73'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: "It's an H-R diagram. It marks stellar temperature and luminosity with color, which perfectly suits the colors you chose.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ah, from the spectroscopy class—what an interesting design.', 3: '76', 4: 'Knowledge has its own beauty.'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Your praise is so direct that I can hardly stop myself from wanting to talk with you more and spend more time together.', 4: '1'}
{3: "The white mechanoid's expression remains calm, yet her words overflow with sincerity."}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Quoted from "Human-Machine Interaction Guide: Intimate Relationships".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: '"When you wish to grow closer to a human, you can express your feelings like this," the book says. Did I use it correctly?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'You used it perfectly.', 3: '81', 4: "(You didn't need to cite your source, but...)", 5: '81'}
{2: "Let's begin, together.", 3: '82'}
{3: 'You pick up the tweezers, and both you and Haicma immerse yourselves in creating.'}
{1: "The white laceflower and baby's breath suggest the reserved curiosity of a first meeting;", 3: '50', 4: 'FFFFFF'}
{3: "The white laceflower and baby's breath suggest the reserved curiosity of a first meeting;"}
{1: 'Marigold and yellow violet recall the lingering longing of separation;', 3: '50', 4: 'FFDE59'}
{3: 'Marigold and yellow violet recall the lingering longing of separation;'}
{1: 'Portulaca and red dianthus evoke hearts leaning gently on each other.', 3: '50', 4: 'FCA8CA'}
{3: 'Portulaca and red dianthus evoke hearts leaning gently on each other.'}
{3: 'The universe is lonely and cold, with vast space and endless time keeping people apart, yet humans build bridges of radiant imagination and pray for reunion.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: 'The composition is perfect. We can proceed. Please hand me the specimen adhesive.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With the two finished collages weighed down to dry, the white mechanoid sits perfectly still at your side, waiting for the glue to set.'}
{3: 'Humans cannot sense the magnetic fields, wavelengths, or other signals mechanoids use to communicate, yet she still tries so hard to sense you.'}
{3: 'Perhaps the understanding between human and mechanoid is itself a miracle as vast as the universe.'}
{2: '"For we are the local embodiment of a Cosmos grown to self-awareness."', 3: '104'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: 'A line from astronomer Carl Sagan. The common view is that his opinions about his field—especially the unknown—were overly sentimental.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'The common view is not the only view.', 3: '107', 4: "I'd like to hear your view."}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: 'Speaking from the heart, I admire another similar line of his and have tried adapting it.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: '【kuroname】, when I look at you, I too glimpse the outline of the universe.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Haicma hands you the framed flower-and-leaf galaxy with both hands, then gently takes your wrist.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Haicma', 3: "Although I traded that bouquet of lilies for the gift, I've planted another pot that should bloom next week.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Haicma', 3: "Even if it isn't a festival, may I still give them to you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'If you wish.', 3: '117', 4: 'Anytime, anywhere.', 5: '117'}
{3: 'Her smile, bright as the galaxy, is answer enough.'}
